intro: Calycothrix pulchella, commonly known as the pretty thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a prickly coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
